span.strong: Berlin-Boylston Public SchoolsSchool Choice Slots Announced

span.p: The Berlin-Boylston Regional Transition School Committee voted on April 14, 2020, to continue to accept a limited number of school choice slots. Details for each school, along with applications for each school are here.

a.title: Go to comments for School Choice Slots Announced

span.strong: ALL BBRSD BUILDINGS TO BE CLOSED THROUGHMAY 4

span.p: As per the order of Governor Baker, all schools in the BBRSD will be closed beginning Monday, March 16 through May 4. Updates will be posted to our website as the situation warrants.

p.span: The 2020-2021 School Calendar was approved at the Berlin-Boylston Regional Transition School Committee Meeting on March 10, 2020. Please click here to see the calendar.

a.title: Go to comments for 2020-2021 School Calendar Approved

span.strong: 2nd Annual Pre-K to K Parent Camp May 13, 2020

p.span: Moving from Preschool to Kindergarten can be a challenge,
with many questions about what to expect when students
get to elementary school and begin a full day of learning. Were
excited to offer you a chance to find out more about what
kindergarten is all about at a short program called Parent Camp.
This event will be held in the cafeteria at Tahanto Regional Middle/High School from 4:00 - 6:00 p.m.
Stay tuned for more details as the day draws closer!

a.title: Go to comments for 2nd Annual Pre-K to K Parent Camp May 13, 2020

span.strong: 2nd Annual Parent Camp is set for June 4, 2020, 5:00-6:30 p.m.!

p.span: Moving from 5th to 6th grade can be a challenging transition, with many questions about what to expect when students get to middle school. Were excited to offer you a chance, as a parent, to find out more about what middle school is all about at this short program called Parent Camp.

span.strong: Dont be fooled, 5th graders! Parent Camp is for you, too!

p.span: While your parents are learning more about what they can do to help and support you at home, youll be learning some ways to start the year off strong by becoming familiar with school routines, expectations, and coursework.

br.span: Stay tuned for more details as we get closer to PARENT CAMP!

a.title: Go to comments for 2nd Annual 5th to 6th Parent Camp is set for June 4, 2020, 5:00-6:30 p.m.

span.p: Third Annual Craft and Vendor Fair at the Boylston Townhouse. Please see attached flyer

a.title: Go to comments for BEF Craft and Vendor Fair

span.p: Please see attached letter regarding Special Education Services Child Find

a.title: Go to comments for Special Education Services Child Find

span.p: The after school bus at Tahanto will begin on September 17, 2019. The bus will run on Tuesdays and Thursdays with pick up at Tahanto at 3:45. Travel time is estimated to be between 30-35 minutes. The bus will drop students off at two different locations in Berlin and Boylston. In Berlin, the stops will be at the General Store, 19 Central Street and the Post Office at 260 Pleasant Street. In Boylston, the stops will be at the Library on 695 Main Street as well as Calliope Theatre at 150 Main Street. On Tuesdays the bus will go to the Berlin stops first and then Boylston. On Thursdays the bus will go to the Boylston stops first and then to Berlin.

a.title: Go to comments for After School Bus at Tahanto

span.p: The Berlin-BoylstonRegional School District has recently adopted a Five Year District ImprovementPlan. You can see that plan in its entirety by clickinghere.

a.title: Go to comments for BBRSD Five Year District Improvement Plan

span.p: Welcome to the Berlin-Boylston School District

span.strong: Governor Bakerhas ordered all MA Public Schools to be closed until May 4, 2020. In accordance with his order, the Berlin-Boylston Regional School District will be closed with a scheduled return on
We will continue to update our website and staff will continue to engage our students while schools are closed.
Please emailyour school principalwith any questions and thank you for your patience during this challenging time.
ALL SCHOOL EVENTS, SPORTS, FIELD TRIPS, AND FACILITY RENTALS ARE CANCELED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE.

strong.span: If your financial situation has changed you may be eligible for free or reduced lunch. Please check the eligibility document below and fill out the application if you qualify. Please return applications to Mary Ellen Fryburg, Food Service Manager. All information is held in the strictest confidence.

span.span: Coronavirus Resources for Parents and Educators

span.a: Letter from BBRSD Director of Finance and Operations regarding pay

span.p: For more information please contact your child's school directly:
Our Mission:To support and challenge all students to achieve personal and academic excellence in a student-centered environment.

Our Vision: The Berlin-Boylston Public Schools will create a challenging learning environment to ensure that all students exhibit continuous improvement and pursue personal excellence and become actively engaged independent learners and decision-makers. As an inclusive school community, instruction will be provided in a caring, safe and healthy learning environment, responsive to each student, in collaboration with families and the community.
